titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. M. M. Clark, Judgment
CWG9869

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
Logan Equity & Criminal Court. January Term 1861.
The Commonwealth of Kentucky Plaintiff
against (3) } Indictment Keeping a Tipling House.
M. M. Clark Defendant

This day came the attorney for the Commonwealth, & the defendant appeared & acknowledged himself guilty of the offense charged in the indictment, it is therefore adjudged by the Court that the defendant make his fine to the Commonwealth by the payment of Sixty dollars, & that he pay the Cost of this prosecution & it is ordered that a capias pro fine issue therefor.

A Copy Attest: Danl Morton
Clerk of said Court.

Logan Equity & Criminal Court, January term 1861.
The Commonwealth of Kentucky, Plaintiff
against (4) } Indictment Keeping a Tipling House
M. M. Clark Defendant

This day came the attorney for the Commonwealth & the defendant appeared & acknowledged himself guilty of the Offense charged in the indictment, it is therefore adjudged by the Court that the defendant make his fine to the Commonwealth by the payment of Sixty dollars, & that he pay the cost of this prosecution,. & it is ordered that a capias profine issue therefor,

A Copy Attest M. B. Morton
D C for Danl Morton Clerk, of Said Court
